title: Defamation case: Supreme Court exempts Shivraj Singh Chouhan from personal appearance; extends order
content: A Bench comprising Justices M.M. Sundresh and Rajesh Bindal deferred to March 26, 2025 the hearing on a plea of Shivraj Singh Chouhan and two other BJP leaders

title: Parliamentary proceedings | Gaganyaan astronauts kept out of public glare to ensure no distractions, informs Jitendra Singh
content: Minister also said that one of the astronauts, Group Captain Shukla, would accompany astronauts from other countries on their journey to the International Space Station

title: Farmer leaders to meet central team for next round of talks
content: Fresh talks between farmers and central delegation in Chandigarh to discuss demands, including legal guarantee for MSP

title: Supreme Court posts challenge to new CEC/EC appointments law to April 16, petitioners say case goes to the very roots of democracy
content: The case was originally listed before the Bench for hearing on March 19, but placed towards the fag end of the board

title: Will abide by party discipline, says Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir
content: The Bharatpur MLA had threatened BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari with dire consequences following the latter’s remarks on ‘throwing out Trinamool’s Muslim MLAs from Assembly’

title: PM Modi welcomes Sunita Williams and crew, says ‘the earth missed you’
content: PM Modi said that the crew have demonstrated what happens when precision meets passion and technology meets tenacity

title: Bombay High Court dismisses PIL against ₹16 crore Mumbai-Thane tunnel project
content: The PIL has sought an investigation by CBI and SIT into the alleged fraud brank guarantees furnished by Megha Engineering Infrastructure Ltd. (MEIL) which has been accepted by Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) and sought direction to MMRDA to cancel the contract awarded to MEIL.

title: Telangana Budget 2025: Concerned over declining State share, Telangana suggests horizontal tax devolution
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, in his Budget speech, says Telangana received only 2.437% of funds under the 14th Finance Commission

title: What did Tamil Nadu’s budget have for the health sector?
content: Experts say that while the move to introduce the cervical cancer vaccine is welcome, there were no announcements on strengthening primary healthcare or recruiting more manpower, both of which are crucial to improve the State’s health landscape

title: A day after Nagpur riots, VHP continues to press for removal of Aurangzeb’s grave
content: VHP general secretary Milind Parande condemns the violence in Nagpur and alleges that the attack on locals and public property was carried out by a section of the minority community

title: Builder-bank nexus making homebuyers cry, CBI probe is must: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has called for a CBI probe into the alleged builder-bank nexus causing distress to homebuyers due to delayed projects. SC wants a detailed proposal from the agency to investigate, stressing the need for quick and effective measures to address the issue.

title: 'Earth missed you': PM Modi celebrates return of 'India's daughter' Sunita Williams
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh and Union minister Jitendra Singh commend NASA astronaut Sunita Williams and her crew for their extraordinary achievements after safely returning from the International Space Station. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expresses pride and admiration for Williams' contributions and accomplishments in space exploration.

title: New Zealand PM Luxon joins Ross Taylor for a game of cricket in Delhi
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon shared his love for cricket by playing with children in Delhi during his India visit. Luxon and Indian Prime Minister Modi discussed deepening cooperation in various fields, including defence and trade. They also signed a Memorandum of Cooperation on Sports to promote collaboration.

title: Nagpur violence: Accused touched female cop inappropriately, FIR reveals
content: A reported Nagpur violence incident involved an accused inappropriately touching a woman police official during a clash. Provoked by the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb, the unrest led to vandalism and multiple injuries. Local residents confirmed significant property damage, while authorities attributed the escalation to misinformation.

title: Why Indian Railways is betting on nuclear power
content: Indian Railways is collaborating with the Department of Atomic Energy and power ministry to establish small nuclear power facilities for its energy needs, aiming for net zero emissions by 2030. The railway network plans to utilize 10 GW of energy, integrating renewable sources with nuclear and thermal power.

title: Elon Musk names Jeff Bezos & Google, Oracle founders as smartest people he knows
content: Elon Musk praised several tech leaders including Larry Ellison, Larry Page, and Jeff Bezos for their intelligence and achievements. Despite Musk and Bezos' past rivalry, their relationship appears to be improving, notably highlighted by Musk's recent memes suggesting reconciliation.

title: Surya to lead MI vs CSK in the absence of suspended Hardik
content: Mumbai Indians' captain Hardik Pandya's suspension for an over-rate offence last year will be enforced in the their upcoming IPL 2025 season opener against CSK on Sunday, making him unavailable for the match. Suryakumar Yadav will lead in his absence, while the return of Jasprit Bumrah from injury remains uncertain.

title: How will Mumbai Indians live without Bumrah? Coach answers
content: Mumbai Indians face the challenge of filling Jasprit Bumrah's void as he recovers from a lower back injury, missing the initial IPL 2025 matches. Skipper Hardik Pandya and coach Mahela Jayawardene aim to find alternatives for his depth and variety in the bowling attack.

title: JP Morgan CEO to Stanford University students: I don’t defend your right to...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has mandated five days of office work starting this month, asserting it is the best way to run the company. Dimon highlighted the importance of in-person work for learning, innovation, and company culture, emphasizing its criticality for younger employees and managerial communication.

title: Four office-goers charred to death as company vehicle catches fire near Pune
content: Four employees of Vyoma Graphics died and five others were injured when their company minibus caught fire in Pimpri Chinchwad near Pune early Wednesday. The fire started near the driver’s feet, and the rear emergency exit failed to open. Police are investigating the incident while the injured are receiving treatment.

title: Why Nagpur burned, cops stone-walled?
content: Nagpur Police were unprepared for the intense communal violence erupted in Old Nagpur, leaving 34 policemen injured. The violence spread from Mahal to Hansapuri due to poor intelligence, misjudgment, and inadequate preparation, despite earlier signs of unrest during a right-wing protest and inflammatory video clips.

title: 'Growing lazy': JD Vance pokes UK again, says immigration leading to stagnation
content: US Vice President JD Vance asserts that Britain's economy is stagnating due to high immigration and reliance on cheap labor, impacting productivity. He defends US tariffs and suggests a mix of tariffs, robotics, and lower energy costs to boost American manufacturing. His comments have sparked controversy and tensions between the US and UK.

title: Reasons why and how Starlink may not become a worry for Airtel and Reliance Jio in India
content: Starlink's satellite internet services will mainly complement existing networks, focusing on expanding access in India's rural areas. Due to higher costs and data caps, Starlink is unlikely to challenge Jio and Airtel's more affordable and faster broadband plans. Collaborations with Indian telcos for Starlink's deployment are pending regulatory approval.

title: Traffic jams cost more than time: Delhi loses lakhs in fuel, productivity
content: VIP movement in New Delhi on Monday morning caused significant traffic disruptions, with an estimated 2 lakh vehicles stuck, wasting around 46,000 litres of fuel. This resulted in financial losses of 44 lakhs and 107 metric tons of CO2 emissions, exacerbating pollution. Additionally, 1 lakh manhours were lost, highlighting the need for better traffic management and improved public transport.

title: ECGC PO final result 2025 declared: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The Export Credit Guarantee Corporation of India (ECGC) has announced the final results for the ECGC Probationary Officer (PO) recruitment 2025. Candidates who appeared for the interview round can check their results on the official website www.ecgc.in. The final merit list is based on the online exam and interview performance. Shortlisted candidates will receive further instructions.

title: J&K police arrest Srinagar youth for ‘glorifying militancy’ online
content: The arrested youth, identified as Showkat Ahmad Dar, “was found to be actively engaged in posting and sharing content aimed at glorifying militancy, militant commanders and inciting anti-national sentiments”

title: Clash over suspected witchcraft claims three lives in Odisha's Ganjam district
content: Though the exact reason for the incident was not known immediately, previous enmity between the two groups in the village was suspected to be the cause of the clash, police said.

title: Fresh violence hits Manipur’s Churachandpur, one dead
content: One tribe’s opposition to the hoisting of the community flag of another triggered clashes in Manipur on Tuesday, March 18 night, hours after the apex bodies of both communities agreed to maintain peace.

title: Kerala Assembly: UDF walks out after Speaker denies adjournment motion on police officers’ transfer row
content: Rejecting the motion, Speaker says ‘only matters of urgent public importance’ can be taken up under Rule 50 for moving adjournment motion

title: Uttar Pradesh man killed by wife and her lover; his dismembered body found in cement-sealed drum
content: According to the victim’s family, Muskan attempted to mislead them by sending messages from Saurabh’s phone and went on a vacation with Sahil to a hill station after committing the crime

title: Tamil Nadu’s secondary school dropout rate at 7%, shows Union Ministry data
content: This is, however, higher than both the national average of 10.9%, according to a UDISE report, and the global school dropout average of 13%, as per a UNESCO report

title: ‘Creating jobs in agriculture is crucial as AI is going to disrupt service sector’
content: Scientist Prof. Chandrashekhar M. Biradar speaks to The Hindu about the many issues related to the agrarian crisis and ways to address it.

title: Modi-Putin relationship ‘may be helpful’ to end Russia-Ukraine war, says Polish Deputy Foreign Minister
content: The comments by Mr. Bartoszewski were made on the sidelines of the Raisaina dialogue being held in New Delhi.

title: ‘No limits to dreams’: Kerala Assembly on Sunita Williams’ achievement
content: Speaker A.N. Shamseer says Sunita Willams’ feat is a ‘sparkling example’ of courage and dedication by a person of Indian origin and therefore, it was a moment of pride for the country as well

title: Nagpur violence: One was to board train, other went for milk; kin wonder how they landed in hospital
content: Khan, a resident of Guard Line near Mominpura, was sent by his mother around 10:30 p.m. to buy milk and curd for the morning sehri. She later received a call at around 11:30 p.m. from IGGMCH, informing her that her son had been admitted to the hospital in critical condition

title: WaxirX reports $478.5 million worth of token assets ahead of investor vote on restructure plan
content: WazirX investors will be able to vote for or against the company’s restructuring plans, following which it will be decided whether to restart exchange operations or not

title: Four office-goers charred to death, five suffer burns as vehicle catches fire near Pune
content: An official said the casualties resulted because the emergency exit at the rear side of the minibus could not be opened

title: Sitapur Congress MP Rakesh Rathore walks out of jail after getting bail in rape case
content: According to police and prosecution, Rakesh Rathore allegedly raped a 45-year-old woman on the pretext of marriage and after promising to help her political career

title: Drug addict arrested for hacking wife to death in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: 25-year-old escaped from the spot after the crime. Victim’s parents who tried to intervene also sustained stab injuries in the attack

title: Jammu: NIA conducts searches at 12 locations in terrorist infiltration case
content: The case was registered last year based on information about the infiltration of active terrorists belonging to proscribed outfits Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed

title: Kolkata family deaths: 14-year-old who lost mother, aunt still homeless
content: 14-year-old Pratip Dey remains without a safe home a month after losing his mother, cousin, and aunt. Authorities are working to place him with relatives or potential adoptive families, but legal and procedural hurdles must first be cleared, including action against his father.

title: How to use Castor Oil to regrow hair on a bald spot
content: Castor oil, enriched with essential fatty acids, vitamins, and minerals, is gaining popularity for its potential to promote hair regrowth on bald spots. Regular application of cold-pressed, organic castor oil can nourish the scalp, improve blood circulation, and strengthen hair follicles. Visible results may be seen in 4-6 weeks with consistent use.

title: Nagpur violence: Officials alarmed by attack’s scale, level of planning
content: Nagpur remains under heightened security with curfew imposed on 30% of the city following violent clashes. Police have fortified sensitive areas and arrested over 50 suspects while 1,200 individuals are accused of involvement. Schools and colleges are shut, and extensive property damage has been reported.

title: Merchant navy officer killed after London return: Wife, lover dismember body
content: A 35-year-old merchant navy officer from London was murdered by his estranged wife and her lover in Meerut. The victim’s dismembered body was sealed in a cement-filled drum, discovered nearly 15 days later. Police arrested the culprits, who tried to cover up the crime by misleading the victim's family.

title: French politician questions US on Statue of Liberty; White House hits back
content: White House spokesperson Karoline Leavitt's putdown came in response to remarks by Raphael Glucksmann, a left-wing politician in France, who said “It (Statue of Liberty) was our gift to you. (US)"

title: Where is the bejewelled crown of the last Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar?
content: The crown of Bahadur Shah Zafar, the last Mughal emperor, and two throne chairs are part of the Royal Collection in London. These items were acquired after the Indian Mutiny of 1857 and symbolize the end of the Mughal Empire and the beginning of British colonial rule in India.

title: 'Declare our daughter dead': Parents of missing PIO student Sudhiksha Konanki
content: A 12-day search for 20-year-old Sudhiksha Konanki in the Dominican Republic ended tragically as her parents requested authorities to declare her dead. The search efforts involved land, water, and air operations. Emotional and physical tolls on Sudhiksha's younger siblings and the family led to this heartbreaking decision.

title: Din in Lok Sabha as Rahul Gandhi rises to speak after PM Modi, denied nod
content: Lok Sabha witnessed chaos after PM Modi's statement on Maha Kumbh, as Rahul Gandhi was denied permission to speak. The opposition protested, leading to adjournment. Rahul supported the PM's statement but noted Modi's omission of homage to stampede victims, criticizing the decision to silence him in the House.

title: Did Serbian authorities use sonic weapons in Belgrade?
content: On Saturday, a large student rally in downtown Belgrade to honor victims of a railway station collapse experienced intense panic due to a loud, mysterious noise. Speculations suggest a 'sound cannon' or 'vortex cannon' might have been used, though Serbian authorities deny deploying any acoustic weaponry. Many attendees sought medical assistance for lingering symptoms.

title: Watch: Sunita Williams smiles and waves after returning to Earth
content: Sunita Williams, Nasa astronaut, returned to Earth after a nine-month stay on the International Space Station. She arrived with fellow astronauts Butch Wilmore and Nick Hague, and cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov. Williams' mission was extended due to issues with Boeing’s Starliner capsule. She set a record for the most spacewalking time for a female astronaut.

title: JFK files: Was a 'CIA clique' responsible for assassination?
content: On March 18, 2025, the Trump administration released 80,000 pages of classified JFK assassination files. A key revelation hints that a CIA faction may have been involved in Kennedy's assassination, renewing debates and speculation, though historians urge caution regarding groundbreaking conclusions.

title: Sunita Williams' Gujarat village celebrates her safe return
content: Jhulasan villagers celebrated Sunita Williams' safe return from space with prayers after her nine-month mission. The Dragon spacecraft successfully returned Williams and three crew members, sparking jubilation. NASA and SpaceX are assisting the astronauts' readjustment to Earth's gravity with medical evaluations scheduled in Houston.

title: Gory night in Delhi's Pitampura: Elderly couple strangled, home ransacked
content: A septuagenarian couple was brutally murdered in their Kohat Enclave home in northwest Delhi. Their new caretaker, who was hired just four days prior and is now missing, is the prime suspect. The incident, which appears to be a robbery, has left the community in shock.

title: Houthis attack US ships: Iran-backed rebel group claim fourth attack in 72 hours
content: Yemeni Huthi rebels, backed by Iran, targeted US naval vessels in the Red Sea, their fourth strike in 72 hours. This followed alleged US attacks on Saada, resulting in significant casualties. The escalating conflict saw reciprocal actions, with the US warning of severe consequences and Iran criticizing the US's involvement, highlighting increased regional tensions and humanitarian concerns.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 6 LIVE: Lok Sabha discusses India’s space and moon missions in Question Hour
content: Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar once again refused to admit notices under Rule 267 in the Upper House.

title: Eknath Shinde questions glorification of Aurangzeb, says ‘he is a blot on our history’
content: ‘Even the United States didn’t allow Osama bin Laden to be buried on its land and disposed of his body into the sea to avoid any glorification,’ says Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde

title: India partners with Meta on digital consumer protection initiative
content: The Ministry of Consumer Affairs on Tuesday announced a partnership with tech company Meta to launch a consumer awareness campaign called "Be an Empowered Consumer"

title: 15,000 tonnes of paddy procured in Nellore so far, says Nadendla
content: The Civil Supplies Minister assures that paddy with a moisture content of 17-20% will also be procured from the farmers and money would be deposited into their accounts within 24 hours of procurement

title: Centre of Competence inaugurated at IIT-Tirupati
content: Esri India ties up with IIT-Tirupati’s Navavishkar i-Hub Foundation (IITTNiF) to establish the centre

title: YSRCP govt. diverted funds meant for capital infrastructure development, says Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav
content: The NDA government in the State has been rectifying the financial issues for the last nine months and submitting verified accounts to the Central government, he says

title: What factors influence women’s political participation?
content: While discussions on women’s participation often highlight the social and cultural biases that hinder their electoral success, less attention is given to how everyday women engage with the electoral process

title: Israel-Hamas war: Why did Netanyahu end the Gaza ceasefire?
content: Both Israel and the U.S. blame the renewed hostilities on Hamas’ refusal to release more hostages before negotiations on ending the war proceed — which was not part of the ceasefire agreement

title: New Zealand PM says looking forward to ink FTA with India in 60 days
content: India and New Zealand began negotiating the Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement (CECA) in April 2010 to boost trade in goods, services, and investment. However, after nine rounds of discussions, the talks stalled in 2015

title: Karnataka reports 12 deepfake-related cybercrime cases in two years
content: The use of deepfake videos to mislead social media users has been on the rise in Karnataka, raising concerns over the potential misuse of artificial intelligence

title: Despite 2024 being warmest year, global warming still below Paris pact threshold
content: The year 2024 is projected to be the warmest on record with a global temperature rise of 1.55 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, per the WMO report. Despite this, long-term warming stays below the Paris Agreement's 1.5-degree threshold. The increase is driven by greenhouse gas emissions and climate events like El Niño.

title: Stock market: BSE Sensex opens over 100 points up; Nifty50 above 22,850
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green on Wednesday. While BSE Sensex was above 75,300, Nifty50 was above 22,850.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Iyer, Chahal key to PBKS title hunt: Shashank
content: Punjab Kings, under new captain Shreyas Iyer and head coach Ricky Ponting, are gearing up for IPL 2025 with renewed confidence. TimesofIndia.com caught up with Shashank Singh to discuss the upcoming season, Shreyas Iyer’s leadership, Ricky Ponting’s influence, the impact of all-rounders Maxwell and Stoinis, Yuzvendra Chahal’s role, and much more.

title: NASA astronaut Sunita Williams family in India planning a grand welcome?
content: NASA astronaut Sunita Williams returned to Earth after an extended nine-month stay on the ISS due to spacecraft issues. She is set to visit India soon, with her family eagerly awaiting her arrival. Prime Minister Modi praised her achievements in a letter, highlighting the pride India takes in her accomplishments.

title: Trump deploys Indian-origin lawyer to defend deportation
content: The Trump administration, led by Indian-origin lawyer Abhishek Kambli, is defying a federal judge's orders to halt deportation flights of illegal immigrants. MAGA activists criticize the judge, claiming bias due to his daughter's work. Kambli argues the orders were issued after the flights had departed, and refuses to disclose details citing national security.

title: Watch: Moment Sunita Williams' craft made spectacular splashdown on Earth
content: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams safely returned to Earth after an unexpected nine-month stay on the ISS due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner crew capsule. They were brought back by SpaceX, which faced its own delays. During their extended mission, they completed crucial experiments and spacewalks, setting records and garnering prayers and support from the American public.

title: Sunita becomes 2nd astronaut to spend longest time in space – see full list
content: NASA astronauts like Peggy Whitson, Sunita Williams, and Scott Kelly have set records for the longest space missions on the ISS, contributing significantly to research and exploration. Their extended stays in space have provided invaluable data on the effects of long-duration spaceflight, crucial for future missions to the Moon and Mars.

title: Virat's U-19 WC teammate lands IPL umpiring job
content: Seventeen years after winning the U-19 World Cup, Virat Kohli, Ravindra Jadeja, and Manish Pandey remain active in the Indian Premier League while former teammate Tanmay Srivastava debuts as an umpire in the upcoming edition. Srivastava, the top-scorer in the 2008 U-19 World Cup final, transitions from playing to officiating at 35, marking a significant career shift.

title: Putin agrees to limit Ukraine attacks but with conditions - Key points
content: United States President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin have agreed on the necessity for a ceasefire and peace in the Ukraine conflict. Their nearly two-hour conversation included discussions on improving US-Russia relations and avoiding future conflicts, with initial steps comprising ceasefires in energy, infrastructure, and maritime operations in the Black Sea.

title: Top stocks to buy today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari of Anand Rathi recommends buying BHEL, Astrazeneca Pharma, and Maruti Suzuki India stocks. These picks show favorable breakout patterns suggesting potential price increases.

title: How have IPL franchises evolved for choice of captains
content: In the evolution of IPL captains, teams now prefer strategic leaders over mere brand icons. Stars like Shane Warne in the past and Shreyas Iyer currently combined tactical acumen with on-field performance. Modern IPL teams focus on players prominent in the playing XI, irrespective of their presence or not in the national T20I team, emphasizing performance and leadership skills.

title: Proposed H-1B wage hike may hurt hiring of freshers, scientists, engineers
content: Proposed wage mandates for H-1B visa holders, including a requirement to pay at least the median local wage, may hinder US companies from hiring skilled foreign workers, warns an NFAP study. These mandates could force employers to move jobs offshore, particularly affecting recent graduates in science and engineering, and could weaken the US workforce in key technology sectors.

title: Don't arm 'terror sponsor' Pakistan, India tells Netherlands
content: India urged the Netherlands to restrict arms and military technology sales to Pakistan due to its history of sponsoring cross-border terrorism. During a high-level meeting, India highlighted that arming Pakistan undermines regional security and emphasized opportunities for collaboration in shipbuilding, AI, and defense technology research.

title: Builders, contractors must give 'no Bangladeshi' undertaking: Maha govt
content: Maharashtra's government requires developers and contractors in Mumbai to ensure they do not employ Bangladeshis and to report any presence to the police. This directive is planned for Navi Mumbai next. The state has arrested and deported a historical number of Bangladeshis but faces difficulties due to lack of cooperation from Bengal regarding documents.

title: Sunita Williams back on Earth, her ancestral Gujarat village over the moon
content: The celebrations began after the successful splashdown of the Dragon spacecraft, which brought Sunita Williams back to Earth along with Crew-9 members Butch Wilmore, Nick Hague, and Russian cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov

title: Rajasthan govt. announces gram, mustard procurement at MSP after criticism by former CM
content: MoS for Cooperative Gautam Kumar Dak said in Jaipur that the State Govt would purchase 13.89 lakh MT of mustard and 6.3 lakh MT of gram as per the targets set by the Centre

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly passes Metropolitan Region and Urban Development Authorities (Amendment) Bill–2025
content: It aims at streamline urban planning and governance in the State, besides empowering urban bodies accord building permissions and layout plans, says Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister Narayana

title: Andhra Pradesh, like Karnataka, should ensure quota in contracts: Congress leader Chinta Mohan
content: Former Union Minister Chinta Mohan criticises Andhra Pradesh’s caste reservation policy, warns against division and discord, opposes privatisation of key assets

title: Govt. urged to speed up investigation into building number scam
content: Kozhikode Corporation unable to take action against culprits as the investigation is incomplete, says report submitted by the secretary

title: ₹590-crore second-phase development of Vyttila Mobility Hub in doldrums
content: Delay in finalising development works attributed to inability of VMHS to seek loan; faced with commuter ire and public criticism over slack upkeep of premises, the society readies ₹10-crore project to renovate existing infrastructure at the hub

title: Moratorium declared on loans of Vilangad landslide survivors
content: Over 100 people were rendered homeless in multiple landslides that hit the region on July 31, 2024, on the same night of the Mundakkai - Chooralmala tragedy in Wayanad.

title: Spend more on healthcare, Rajya Sabha MPs tell Centre
content: Budget allocation for health has dipped in last seven years, says DMK MP Tiruchi Siva; says Centre should focus on uniform population control before delimitation; life expectancy has improved, says BJP MP Bhagawat Karad

title: Judicial probe will be initiated into Kulgam deaths, says J&K Deputy Chief Minister
content: Deputy Chief Minister Surinder Chowdhary, along with other officials, visited the victims’ families in Kulgam’s Devsar area

title: Trade unions to stage strike on May 20 against labour codes
content: A declaration adopted at a convention of labour unions said that in its third term, the Narendra Modi-led NDA government has become atrociously desperate to push through “corporate servile policy machinations” on the toiling populace.

title: Tamil Nadu government re-designates its Additional Advocates General
content: AAG J. Ravindran has been accommodated in the sixth position among 11 AAGs and given additional responsibility of coordination between the government and the judiciary

title: Railways Demand for Grants (2025-26) passed in Lok Sabha amid noisy protests
content: Union Minister Vaishnaw highlighted the decrease in railway accident rate and the relative affordability of tickets; called on CMs to ease land aquisition

title: Congress top brass confer on ways to strengthen district committees
content: Sources said the top brass of the party discussed a report by Mukul Wasnik on empowering the DCCs. Some key suggestions included consulting DCCs on important political developments, five-year terms for DCC presidents, not allowing DCC chiefs to contest elections for three years, and so on

title: Supreme Court judges to visit Manipur relief camps on March 22
content: The visit by the judges’ team headed by Justice B.R. Gavai highlights the ongoing need for legal and humanitarian assistance to affected communities

title: 'Hamas responsible for this war': Netanyahu after renewed Gaza attacks
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blamed Hamas for the renewed violence, defending Israel's military operations in Gaza. Netanyahu asserted efforts were made to avoid conflict, but Hamas rejected truce proposals, prompting the offensive. The recent strikes reportedly killed 404 Palestinians and wounded over 560, escalating the conflict further.

title: Maharashtra CM calls Nagpur violence pre-planned, Opposition asks Fadnavis to resign
content: Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde calls the incident a ‘conspiracy’; CM Fadnavis claims that the recently released film Chhaava instigated people’s sentiments against Mughal ruler Aurangzeb leading to the arson

title: Pact signed for using Parliament data to train indigenous AI model: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Parliament dataset will be a very good resource for training our model, similarly Doordarshan and All India Radio are other sources where large datasets are available, says Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Pakistan should vacate Indian territory under its illegal and forcible occupation: MEA
content: Islamabad had accused India of ‘fomenting terrorism in Pakistan’ and of ‘state sanctioned oppression’ in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Prayers on lips, celebrations on ground: Sunita Williams' ancestral Gujarat village plans 'Deepavali'
content: Jhulasan village in Mehsana district, known as the ancestral home of Sunita Williams' father, Deepak Pandya, is alive with excitement

title: Tripura Opposition wants Minister removed for ‘derogatory’ remarks
content: CPI(M) leader Jitendra Chaudhury said Fisheries Minister Sudhangshu Das accused several political parties of endorsing the brutality of Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb

title: How a ‘cine extra’ from Bangalore, who struck at schools and hostels in Madras, was arrested
content: Between September 4, 1962 and November 6, 1963, a series of daytime burglaries occurred in Madras. The police were left in the lurch as the fingerprints did not match. On January 5, 1964, Krishnappa was arrested in Kodambakkam after a lengthy investigation. He admitted to have been involved in all the 27 break-ins during 14 months

title: When Madras High Court was approached ‘in the absence’ of a Council of Ministers
content: While being hospitalised in the U.S., MGR led the AIADMK to a record victory in the 1984 Assembly election. Immediately after he formed his government in February 1985, two petitions argued that while filing nomination from hospital, a candidate should take his oath before a medical practitioner, not before a consular agent as MGR did

title: Summer rain brings relief amid sweltering heat but disrupts normal life in parts of Thiruvananthapuram
content: Tthe torrential rain, accompanied by lightning, led to waterlogging in various areas across Thiruvananthapuram city on March 18

title: Let’s Talk series as part of Kochi-Muziris Biennale 2025-26 begins
content: Programme marks beginning of a series of public conversations that will travel across Kerala in the lead-up to the sixth edition of KMB 2025-26

title: Nagpur violence: We are ascertaining whether there was a mastermind, says Police Commissioner
content: Till the imposition of curfew, people will be able to step out for essential services only, says Ravinder Singal; he adds that police has imposed Section 307 where ‘one of our senior officials was attacked by an axe’

title: Man held for illegal mining of sand in Tirupattur
content: The team patrolled the area including an irrigation tank, open government land and riverbed after repeated complaints of illegal sand theft; Tirupattur SP Sheya Gupta has formed additional teams to intensify patrolling in the district to prevent illegal mining of sand from lakes and Palar river

title: Burglar who broke into Telangana MP DK Aruna’s residence nabbed
content: Investigation revealed that Akram had a history of involvement in similar offences with at least 17 cases booked against him in Delhi between 2017-2024

title: ‘Hyderabad faced third worst winter pollution in country’
content: The Industrial Development Area of Pashamylaram was the most polluted location among all in the three south Indian mega cities, with a seasonal average of 62 µg/m³

title: Union Finance Minister’s remarks about Kerala in Rajya Sabha misleading: Sivankutty
content: State Labour Minister says work conditions in Kerala much better after Ms. Sitharaman spoke of alleged impact of communism on industry in the State

title: Mirth, merriment fill IGMC stadium during legislators’ sports meet in Andhra Pradesh
content: Assembly Speaker Ch. Ayyanna Patrudu inaugurates the competitions; MLAs and MLCs participate in cricket, throwball, badminton, tug of war and volleyball competitions on Day 1 of three-day tourney

title: Bombay HC refuses to interfere in lower court order staying Maharashtra Minister’s conviction
content: Maharashtra Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate’s advocate opposed the petitions and said they are not maintainable as the petitioner was not a complainant in the case, and hence has no locus standi

title: Karnataka High Court orders CBI probe into murder of former Kolar ZP president M. Srinivas
content: Special Public Prosecutor (SPP) representing the CID admits that the ‘investigation conducted is so shoddy that it fails to follow rudimentary principles of conduct of investigation’

title: Jadavpur University: One student arrested in connection with March 1 violence
content: Bengal Governor C.V. Ananda Bose says Jadavpur University VC should take a call on having a campus police outpost

title: 'Focused' Heels stomp Aztecs, critics in First 4
content: RJ Davis had 26 points on 8-of-12 shooting, and North Carolina, criticized around college basketball this week for landing a berth in the NCAA tournament, stomped San Diego State 95-68 in a First Four game Tuesday night in Dayton, Ohio.

title: Indiana names WVU's DeVries as new head coach
content: The Indiana Hoosiers have hired West Virginia's Darian DeVries as new head coach of the men's basketball program, the school announced Tuesday.

title: Kupp ready for his 'new adventure' with Seahawks
content: Seattle wide receiver Cooper Kupp, 31, displayed his Seahawks jersey on Tuesday, telling reporters that he's excited as he steps "into this new adventure, this new place, this new chapter in my career" following a standout run with the Los Angeles Rams.

title: Alabama St. wins thriller with own spin on Hail Mary
content: Amarr Knox's layup with a second left lifted Alabama State to its first NCAA tournament win Tuesday night, 70-68 over Saint Francis in a matchup of No. 16 seeds in the First Four.

title: Steelers' Heyward fed up waiting on Rodgers
content: Steelers defensive tackle Cameron Heyward said on his podcast Tuesday that he has no plans to recruit Aaron Rodgers and that he just wants Pittsburgh's quarterback situation settled.

title: Poch: 'Big mistake' for USMNT to focus on politics
content: U.S. men's national team coach Mauricio Pochettino dismissed the political overtones surrounding the Concacaf Nations League finals, calling it a "big mistake" for his team to discuss politics.

title: All smiles, Bengals' Chase, Higgins eye fresh goal
content: The Bengals held a joint news conference Tuesday in the wake of their star receivers Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins signing four-year contract extensions.

title: Source: Hardman gets one-year deal from Packers
content: Mecole Hardman, 27, a veteran wide receiver and return specialist, is signing with Green Bay on a one-year deal, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler, and though he's not the No. 1 receiver the Packers might be lacking, he does add speed to the positions.

title: Giant Killers: Predicting 10 women's March Madness early-round upsets
content: Looking for upsets in the women's March Madness bracket? Harvard, Vanderbilt and South Dakota State are looking to hang around.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: 'I didn't know Kyle Tucker spoke': Why the 'silent assassin' could be MLB's next $400 million star
content: He might not be a household name, but the new Cubs outfielder is still the same slugger he was back when he was breaking records in high school.

title: Robinson among USMNT trio ruled out for CNL
content: The U.S. men's national team will be without Real Betis midfielder Johnny Cardoso, Fulham defender Antonee Robinson and Celtic center back Auston Trusty for the Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: Cavallo reveals daily death threats for being gay
content: Josh Cavallo, men's football's first openly gay active player, said he struggles encourage other players to come out due to the sport's "toxic" environment.

title: Eriksen expects Man United exit at end of season
content: Manchester United midfielder Christian Eriksen has said he expects to leave the club at the end of the season but added that he's not ready to move back to home-country Denmark yet

title: Aguirre: Still paying for error vs. U.S. at 2002 WC
content: Mexico coach Javier Aguirre said he's still "paying consequences" for a tactical error in the 2002 World Cup that led to a stunning 2-0 loss to the United States in his first run with the national team.

title: Sources: Wave agree fee for Colombia CB Arias
content: The San Diego Wave have agreed a deal to sign Colombian defender Daniela Arias from Brazil's Corinthians, multiple sources told ESPN.

title: U.S. Open Cup prize money doubles to record $1M
content: U.S. Soccer announced Tuesday it will be doubling the prize money for the 2025 U.S. Open Cup, reaching a record-breaking $1 million in an effort to continue building interest in the tournament.

title: Madrid frustrate Arsenal to get UWCL 1st-leg win

title: Extra-Marital Affair And Husband's Murder. Then A Movie-Style Cover-Up

title: "Rejected For...": Elon Musk Says Joe Biden Blocked Sunita Williams Offer
content: astronauts sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore return home after nine-month stay at the international space station . spaceX CEO Elon Musk congratulates spaceX and NASA teams for "another safe astronaut return" he says spaceX offered former president Joe Biden's administration to bring back the two astronauts but it was "rejected for political reasons"

title: "Will Throw Samosa Party": Sunita Williams' Family Says India Visit Soon
